comments_since_last_sample.body:
Disclaimer: am a bassist. Not a drummer. This is just, like, my opinion maaaann.

A few of my picks have already been stated (Zep and Rush are a given, everyone knows Dave Grohl goes hard on drums love me some TCV, and Travis Barker is a huge part of why I like Blink) so I'll mention a few I'm not sure others will mention:

Ben Thatcher of Royal Blood. Literally any song by them features him in a big way; he's half the band, after all.

Matt Donnelly of Don Broco. Hard to think of a specific song but I feel he's in the spotlight a lot on their new album.

And I feel like a lot of people sleep on Josh Dunn of TØP. Another drummer who's half the band and really brings it. Guy grooves.
[toe - Goodbye](https://youtu.be/aVLviSRNeLw)
Who’s Next by The Who, Keith Moon on drums. One of the best to ever do it.
Rosetta Stoned- Tool

#43 - Dave Matthews Band - Carter Beauford

There is a video on youtube of him playing this song.. its very good

Edit: the # on the name of the music made the letters big
Periphery: Absolomb
Anything by tool
Matt Helder’s work on Whatever People Say I Am, That’s What I’m Not is great given how long he was playing for.

JP from Clutch is a very solid drummer with bucket loads of groove.

https://youtu.be/dX9hJZ3LTWw
The beginning of qotsa songs for the deaf live with Dave grohl gives me a musical boner, I’ve heard the song so many times I only listen to the intro then I turn it off
13 steps to nowhere-pantera - Vinnie Paul was a beast.
Id have said Zeppelin but someone else already did.  Rush is a big drum band. Check out Spirit of Radio for an example .  A lot of Green Day and Blink 182 do as well.

Any Police.  Copeland may not be the most technical drummer, but nobody really sounds like him.  It’s hard to just say one song so I’ll give one per album.
So Lonely, Walking on the Moon, Driven to Tears, One World(Not Three), and Wrapped Around Your Finger.

Here's Danny Carey from Tool while they perform Pneuma 
https://youtu.be/FssULNGSZIA
Check out the album Fear Inoculum by Tool. It’s Danny Carey’s masterpiece. Specifically the songs Descending and Invincible.

Couple of great metal drummers:

Charlie Benante’s drumming is almost otherworldly on the album *Among The Living* (he’s damn good in most of Anthrax’s work, too!).

Nick Menza is terrific on Megadeth’s *Rust In Peace*.

Seven Days - Sting - Vinnie Colaiuta

Rosanna - Toto - Jeff Porcaro

Fool in The Rain - Led Zeppelin- John Bonham

Cult of Personality - Living Color - Wil Calhoun

50 ways to Leave Your Lover - Paul Simon - Steve Gadd

Beulah Witch - Buddy Rich Big Band - Matt Sorum (listen to Burning for Buddy)

Give me Shelter - Rolling Stones - Charlie  Watts

Brian Wilson - Bare Naked Ladies - Tyler Stewart

___________ - Tool - Danny Carey ( the go find his jazz)

Spirit of Radio - Rush - Neil Peart

Fame - David Bowie - Dennis Davis
Check out any Fela Kuti song. Fela's music doesn't work, without Tony Allen's ability to outline the pulse and clave.
Jd Beck
Late in the evening, Paul Simon
Many fine examples in Steely Dan and Toto.
Almost all of zeps albums.  I say almost..in through the outdoor JB was pretty out of it as was Jimmie.
Listen to the album hemispheres by rush. The drummer for the band rush (Neil Peart) is considered the best in the world and his drumming is unreal.
